text.text_translated: There are still many questions about the influence of genetics on the development of our brain and language. A **gene** is a part of our DNA that controls how we grow. For example, did a special gene change in a way that gave us the ability to speak? Researchers have found a gene that changed between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This change seems to be connected with speaking. It also relates to how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not have this same change. It is too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day we might find the answers in our DNA.
